thread.title: A6 Stockport Road closed after serious crash involving motorbike - latest updates
thread.title_full: A6 Stockport Road closed after serious crash involving motorbike - latest updates

author: Simon Coyle
title: A6 Stockport Road closed after serious crash involving motorbike - latest updates
text:
As a result a number of bus services are still running a diversion route. 09:26 Where crash happened 
The crash happened on Stockport Road between Crayfield Road and Broom Lane (circled). 
The closure is causing traffic to back up along the A6, in both directions, and along Broom Lane. 09:20 Two ambulances called to scene 
A spokeswoman for the North West Ambulance Service said: 
We were called to attend reports of a collision between a motorbike and a car. 
We sent a rapid response vehicle and two ambulances to the scene. We have taken one patient to Manchester Royal Infirmary. It looks like he has got injuries to the leg. 09:17 Rider suffered leg injury 
The car involved was a grey Subaru Impreza and the motorcycle was a blue and silver Lexmoto. 
A police spokesman said the motorbike rider has a leg injury. 
Everyone inside the car did not suffer any injuries. It is unknown how seriously injured he is at this stage. 
The road remains closed while police investigate. 09:16 
The closure is affecting bus services which use the road. 09:12 'Serious RTC' 
Police say the incident is a serious RTC and have asked drivers to avoid the area. 09:11 
A motorcyclist has been injured following a collision in Levenshulme. 
Police have closed Stockport Road in both directions, between Crayfield Road and Broom Lane. 
The collision took place on Marley Road at about 7.20am this morning. 
A spokesman for Greater Manchester Police said the rider was taken to hospital in an ambulance. 
The extent of his injuries is unknown at this stage. 
The road temporarily re-opened, but officers made the decision to close it again. (Photo: Anwar Iftikhar)
